result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Benjamin K. Treppish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay fine including costs at a rate of $50/mo commencing on or before 5/15/15 and each month thereafter until paid in full

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin K. Treppish

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
14CF353 & 16CF208: Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State and Atty. Klomberg heard on recomm.; DPA in count 2 in 14CF353 will be dismissed, Def. to plead to Del. of THC as indicated in the Inforamtion in 16CF208; Court conducts Initial in 16CF208; Def. waives PH; Court reviews right to same; State files Information; Court binds over to Br. 1; will proceed to P&S; Court reviews recomm.; State moves to amend Information offense date to 11/8/13 (same as count 2 in 14CF353); Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC; State now moves to dismiss Count 2 in 14CF353; Court orders Count 2 in 14CF353 is dismissed; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Manuf./Del. THC in 16CF208; State heard; Atty. Vollan heard; Court imposes sentence; report to P&P on Monday

W/H - 18 mo. PO - 20 days credit if revoked
- 30 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. - Imposed and Stayed for Agent's use with approval of the Court
- $268 CC w/in 60 days
- $250 DNA surcharge and sample
- AODA & FT
- Continue to engage in treatment designed to deal with controlled substance issues
- not use/possess controlled substance, etc. w/o valid prescription
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- Exp. upon successful completion of probation
Motion hearing on June 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Disscussion held regarding DPA; matter to be reset to allow DA to draft new complaint;  Motion hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on May 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin via phone. Competency report rec'd and reviewed by all; Atty. Vollan heard - Def. agrees that he has regained competency and does not contest the opinion of the doctor; State heard; Court finds Def. is competent to proceed at this point; Motion to revoke DPA needs to be reset; discussion on scheduling; TSC 3/29/16 at 8:30am; bond cont.

Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's mother also appears. Competency Report now received. Discussion held. Doctor Report marked and received. Court heard and finds not competent (per report), commits to DHS to determine treatment. Proceedings are suspended at this time. Court sets TSC in 60 days.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Vollan heard on motion to revoke DPA, brings up competency issue. Ct. heard, orders competency evaluation, cannot go forward w/ motion until competency issue is resolved. Atty Klomberg heard, agrees. Discussion held. Atty Vollan heard, requests that the valuators contact Def. through his mother, Chastity Gable - 920-210-8050, 102 N. Cedar St. Horicon.  Telephone status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $40 by next court date.   Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:49) Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in custody via video with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (for Vollan).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Button heard on Def.'s FTA, never rec;d notice; State heard on bond, removed from TAD program due to numerous FTA, requests high cash, $20,000; Atty. Button response; Court orders: $1,000 CASH Bond:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $40 by next court date.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. MH to revoke DPA is 11/24/15 at 10:15am in Br. 1

Attorney Greg E. Vollan appeared. Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish not in court. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vollan heard. Atty Klomberg heard, requests warrant So Ordered.

Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  NC plea entered on counts 2 & 3 of the Amended Information.  Atty Barrington moves to amend count 3 of the Amended Information to reflect possession of lisdexamfetamine not tetrahydrocrocannabinols.  No objection by Atty Vollan.  Court accepts pleas and finds def guilty on count 3 only;      count 1 is DRI.  Counsel heard on sentencing recomendation regarding count 3.  Court withholds finding of guilt on count 2 and approves the DPA.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Count 3:

$100 fine + costs
$50/mo. comm 5/15/15 and 15th of each month thereafter or 14 days DCJ
Def to go to clerks office to set up payment plan
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Kurt Klomberg.  DEF, Benjamin Treppish apprs in person along with Atty Greg Vollan.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.

Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant and defendant waive prelim;  Arraignment scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:11 - Defendant Benjamin K. Treppish in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
